change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 286/2006, effective October 24, 2006.

section.sectiontext: In this regulation, IDSA Loan means the money owed or owing by Duke Point Development Limited under a loan agreement between the government and Duke Point Development Limited dated January 22, 1980 as amended November 7, 1980.
The government may pay the British Columbia Assets and Land Corporation up to a total of $2 812 089 from the consolidated revenue fund as remuneration for:

paragraph.paragraphtext: collecting, managing and accounting for the IDSA Loan;
the post-closing costs from the sale of BC Online to MacDonald Dettwiler and Associates Ltd.;
the costs from investigating the potential disposition of LandData BC;
the costs arising from the asset disposition and business opportunity projects approved by Treasury Board on February 23, 2000.

content.regnote: Note: this regulation repeals B.C. Reg. 41/2000.
content.provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Financial Administration Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 138, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 14 (2)]
